title: Chicago's Airports Expect Increase In Passengers Over Labor Day WeekendTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Chicago’s Airports Expect Increase In Passengers Over Labor Day Weekend
The Chicago Department of Aviation (CDA) anticipates more than 1.2 million passengers will travel through O’Hare and Midway International Airports for the Labor Day travel period from Friday, September 4 to Tuesday, September 8. Both of Chicago’s airports will see an increase in passenger volume over a comparable Memorial Day travel period in 2014.This weekend marks the official end of the busy summer travel season.
“On behalf of Mayor Rahm Emanuel, we are pleased and prepared to welcome travelers at O’Hare and Midway this Labor Day weekend,” said CDA Commissioner Ginger S. Evans. “The increase in passenger volume for one of the world’s busiest airport systems signals good things for the aviation industry and our region’s economy.”
Passenger volume at O’Hare is expected to reach nearly 964,000 during the five-day travel period, an increase of four percent over 2014. Midway will welcome nearly 330,000 passengers, an increase of three percent over last year. The busiest travel day at both airports is projected to be Friday, September 4, with more than 220,000 passengers at O’Hare and nearly 76,000 passengers at Midway.
American flags and patriotic decor will be displayed at various locations outside and inside both airports, including airport shops and restaurants. 21050903_Labor Day Airport ambassadors at Midway will offer complimentary lemonade to passengers on Friday, September 4 and on Tuesday, September 8.
The Travelers Aid office at O’Hare will have staff and volunteers available over the weekend on both the arrival and departure levels of all terminals. The main office will be open to assist passengers on the following days: Friday, September 4, Saturday, September 5 and Sunday, September 6.
The main USO office in Terminal 2 at O’Hare will be open 24-hours a day over the holiday weekend for all traveling military personnel.
Concessionaires at both airports will offer passengers a complimentary Patriotic Pin with any store or restaurant purchase on Labor Day, Monday, September 7, while supplies last.
Families looking for a kid-friendly place to relax at O’Hare can visit the “Kids on the Fly” play area in Terminal 2. Volunteer airport ambassadors stationed at the information booths at Midway will provide assistance to passengers.
The CDA is pleased to offer a clean and comfortable room at both airports for traveling mothers to nurse, use a breast pump or care for young children. The Mother’s Room at O’Hare is located past security in Terminal 3, on the mezzanine level of the Rotunda Area, near the Yoga Room and Urban Garden. The Mother’s Room at Midway is located past security, on the way to the A Concourse, and next to the Yoga Room as well.
Source:- Chicago Department Of Avoation
